data.title: filthy
data.text: Place is filthy.   They didnt change the sheets, it was dirty.   The bathroom was filty.   I landed drove  here checked in .   Went in and looked at the room.   Called Travelocity to get a refund  immediately.   This place made my skin crawl:

data.title: dirty and a mess!!
data.text: first room the wifi didn't work. not a huge deal and they gave us a different room. 2nd room had a broken window and door. the door did lock but not like it should. television didn't work. the manager did fix the tv. I didn't think it was very clean and I was right. it was dirty. when I tried to shower there was no hot water! bathroom was NOT CLEAN!!! I went back and told them I couldn't stay here and why. they did credit my card and I did get a refund the next day. I travel a lot and this was the absoult worst place I have ever stayed in anyplace in the entire country

data.title: A dated place, but its cheap, quiet, and nice enough
data.text: I have stayed here a dozen times over the past 6 or 7 years.  It's always quick to get in, they are kind enough to allow early check in and late check out, and they extend random discounts as well.  It's not always the cleanest place, but it is the cheapest, and theres a nice 24 hr diner next door.  It's convenient to Sterling Heights.  If you are looking for the Holiday Inn, this isn't it. If you want to be treated fairly and get a decent value, this is the place.  Their internet works well, too.

data.title: Worst Service Ever
data.text:
I unfortunately stayed at this property on August 16, 2015 and won't stay there again.  When I checked in I was told I couldn't use my Wyndham Points card to get my points for that stay. She took a very long time to check the 3 of us that were waiting to check-in too.
When I got to my room and closed the door you could see the outside.  Someone could have pushed hard on the door and broke in.
I called the front desk and asked for more towels and pillows.  I had to go get the towels and that is when she told me she couldn't get the pillows for me until her shift was over. I said really that by then I'd be in bed asleep. She then called the room about 15 minutes later and said she could get the pillows.  When she finally showed up I showed her the door and asked how they could rent that room let alone to a female looking like that.  She had nothing to say about it.
The bathroom was awful too.  It was very small and cramped, the bathtub looked like it was permanently stained and was GROSS.
I travel quite a bit and have stayed in nicer places than this for the same amount of money it cost me to stay here.
As I said I will never stay there again and would never recommend this motel to anyone.  Stay away!!

data.title: Disgusting not recommended
data.text: We stayed one night the room wasn't clean the tub wasn't clean the soap dish has clumps of soap scum the mattress smelled really bad the room next to ours the housekeeper didn't change the sheets she just pulled them back on the bed I will never stay there again they are nasty places they don't change the sheet after someone checks out and very rude people

data.title: Absolutely awful
data.text: We stayed here for 1 night, in february.  The room was ice cold we checked in. We ran the heat full blast for 30 minutes before it got warm enough to take our coats off (and no, the room wasnt big.) While we were standing around in our coats waiting to warm up, we saw a couple of thing that made us a little sick to our stomachs.  First was a rhinestone and glitter on the bedspread. We assume it was from a hooker, since they seem to favor this motel. Next was a couple short n curlies in the bathtub. Gross. The bathroom surfaces werent cleaned, gunk and general buildup.  The heater had black mold on it near where it meets the wall. The window was broken in the corner and cold air was coming in.  There was a rusty screw on the window sill.  The lock on the door was ridiculous, attached to moulding that was already loose. A toddler could have broken in! When we came back from dinner there was a stinkbug crawling up the wall (mind you this feb. In michigan) where did he come from?! Gross gross gross room. But it was cheap!  We checked out early, and wont ever stay there again.  They dont clean the rooms and everything just feels dirty in there.

data.title: The absolute worst!
data.text: I believe you get what you pay for...but when you pay for a place to sleep it should at least provide clean sheets and a clean room. This was the worst place I have ever been to. In addition to the stink, the pain was peeling and the room was filled with fruit flies! You might save a few dollars but there's no telling what you'll bring home from this hell hole! It should be torn down!

data.title: A Night with the Knight
data.text: Nestled between 17 mile and Van Dyke lies the quaint and cost effective Knights Inn. Although the name may suggest somewhat of a medieval decor, we were disappointed to discover no more than a traditional 90s motel motif. The staff was a crew of colorful characters, attentive and attractive, they are the standard to which others in the industry should compare The room itself was clean and cozy. We were surprised to find both a refrigerator and microwave. The size of the appliances allowed us to store not only our leftover Chili's takeout container, but also a mini tub of guacamole and salsa. Although we didn't use it, the bathroom featured a bottle opener mounted on the wall next to the toilet, giving a new meaning to the phrase "out with the old, in with the new." Don't be deterred by the continental breakfast. Even though the idea of a continental breakfast boasts on an abundance of variety, we were only offered blueberry muffins and weak coffee, but it is important to note that the muffins were magnificent. Crumbly and sweet with a slight tang from the blueberry chunks, I dare say it was the second best thing I placed in my mouth that morning. The only complaint I had was the low thread count of the towels, which caused my supple skin to slightly chaff. Overall it was a great night at Knight's and contrary to popular belief, one does not have to be knighted in order to stay there.

data.title: Great value
data.text:
For the price the non smoking room was clean, with fresh linens. Everything worked  in the room with no issues and was surprised that it had a refrigerator and microwave.  We missed the continental breakfast which occured before 10 a.m., but had coffee there just the same. Also 
we noted that do to snow that occured during our stay, staff cleaned the walkways first thing in the morning, and also mopped the lobby floor continuously to keep it clean from the snow issues.
We would stay there again no problem.

data.title: No housekeeping services
data.text: For the third consecutive year, my husband stayed at this Knights Inn over a weekend because he was attending an event nearby. The first year his room wasn't cleaned after the first night. The second year the same thing happened! This year, when he checked in he specifically told the desk staff that he had been there twice previously and his room had not been cleaned either time. Excuses were made, such as, "Did you leave something on the bed?" "Were you in the room during the time the housekeeper would have been available to clean your room?" Answering no to both questions, he was assured that this would not happen again this time. Well, guess what? Returning to his room after his first overnight, and having been away all day, once again nobody had been in the room to do even the most basic housekeeping. Wastebaskets were not emptied, towels were not replaced, of course the bed not made, nothing. When this happened before, we thought the housekeeper must have been confused. A second time, quite a coincidence to get no service on two different stays. Three times, we now believe this is the policy of this motel - no housekeeping services are done, period. Ridiculous!

data.title: Unwelcomed guest with 8 legs
data.text: My stay was horrible. Remote didnt work, sink with cigarette burns, urine smelled rooms, found blonde hair in my sheets(and we are brunettes), the bugs....oh the bugs...omygod...thee bugs. I only had my night clothes and next day clothes in the room in a backpack. I left it in that room. Thank God there was a burlington coat factory across the street and other hotels around. I checked out. No apologies. THAT PLACE NEED TO BE LEVELED!!! Its infested.

data.title: Dont let the bed bugs bight.
data.text: My heat went out in my house on the coldest night in February. I specifically told them I needed heat for me and two children. When I got to the room at 12am, the room was cold and smelled like urine. they gave us another room. At 3:45am, my child woke up to bed bugs on her bed. she gave us $1.00 to dry them from thier raggedy dryer from the 1960's. We switched rooms again and we all couldnt caught cancer from second hand cigarette smoke seeping from the walls. THEY HAVE BED BUGS! Unless you like insects, dont bother. You can take them home.

data.title: No Problems Here
data.text:
I have been reading the reviews regarding this motel. I really don't agree with any of them. My wife and I were in this area this past weekend and we rnted a room there for one night June 29th. 2012. Unlike the comments from previous people we experienced a lot different ime there. Here is a run down of our visit.

Hotel Room : Very clean - I would give it a rate of above good.
Management : very helpful and very polite.
Staff : Very fiendly and helpful.
We never experienced any problems with this motel and we would certainly stay there again if in that area and would recommend it to our friends.

data.title: Can't even make beds....
data.text:
I stayed at this hotel last night, we had a room with 2 double beds in however one bed was not made fully (the pillows were on the table and there was no duvet) and the other bed had a dirty base sheet.  

Everything in this room needed replacing.  The toilet constantly made a noise of running water through the night, the bathroom door didn't shut properly, the carpet looked dirty, the bed sheets had cigarette holes in them (despite being in a non smoking room), you could hear noise from the road, and each car that went by.

When checking out the man asked if we had a good stay, i replied with no not really the one bed was dirty and the other wasn't made, he didn't reply while he was on the computer but then he said Oh sorry about that.  And that was it.

Needless to say, between the constant running of the toilet and the car noises, neither of us got much sleep at all!

data.title: Get what you pay for...almost
data.text: I frequently stay in this hotel only because I have a very limited budget and travel to the area often. The rooms always smell funky. All of the couches I've seen are nasty and torn; I will not sit on them. Most of the floors are cracked under or through the carpet. Furnishings vary by room. Several times, my room has not been cleaned between nights of multi-night stays. Bathroom fixtures typically have some sort of problem. I have stayed in many cheap/budget/economy motels and this one is consistently among the least impressive.

data.title: Rude Managment and dirty.
data.text: After one night at this hotel, I should have asked for my money back and found another! We had paid for two nights. The following morning around 11:00 AM we were asked to leave. When I inquired about this, I was told we had only paid for one night. After an hour of explaining the situation and showing my recipt. The manager finally agreed. Later that evening around 7:00 PM the same thing happened. Only this time they booked new people into the room and insisted that we leave. Another hour of explaining to the now manager on duty and we were finaly able to stay. I cant imagine what the problem was when it looks like the front of this place is occupied by street people and people looking to party. Shortly after departure I caontacted the corporate office. They were not much help at all. I did not ask for any reimbursement or stay vochures but they acted like it was no big deal. When I mentioned that I will NEVER stay at another Knights Inn anywhere. They simply said okay that is your choice. The management was rude. They hardly spoke English. The room was dirty and most off all we did not feel safe. I would not recomend anyone to stay at this establishment.

data.title: Never Again - Full of Drugs and Hookers
data.text: My company HAD to place me here when there was something big going on in the area and no decent hotels around Memorial Day Weekend.  My room smelled of smoke, but also smelled like this gut wrenching burning smell of crack.  There were many shady characters coming and going, baseball caps and "body art" and piercings, looking perhaps to either buy or sell drugs, there was constant action in and out of a variety of rooms.  I also did not feel safe as a woman, as there were several "call girls" roaming around, and none of them looked too healthy with scars and marks on their faces and arms and legs, scary!

data.title: I have NEVER had anything comparable to this type of incompetent, unworthy, miserable experience.
data.text:
Here is a record of my experience when staying at the Knights Inn Motel in Sterling Heights, Michigan on June 5th and 6th, 2010.
1.	The first room to which I was assigned was a SMOKERS room. 
2.	The second room had three light bulbs burned out, 
a. The bed was partially turned down.
b. A pair of women's high-heel shoes was next to the bed.  
c. The telephone did not operate. 
       3. The third room was a SMOKERS room. 
       4. The fourth room had a dirty Jacuzzi. 
All the rooms were minimally clean (dirty). 
Sunday night I ordered a wake-up call for Monday at 4:00 AM, which never came. 
I was told it wasn't answered, not true, as I am a light sleeper, it never rang!  
I am a semi-retired, experienced world traveled business executive. 
I have NEVER had anything comparable tothis type of incompetent, unworthy, miserable experience in the 50+ years of travel!
